pull.title: Revert "Fixes Bug in Transaction generation in ComplexMempool benchmark"
pull.body: Developers are reporting crashes (potentially OOM) on IRC, but I can't reproduce. Still, revert this for now, since one developer reported the bare metal this was running on crashed.

events.body: Is it ok that this PR is not based on the master branch? I mean, a commit parent is not a merge commit.

> Is it ok that this PR is not based on the master branch?

Huh, I think it is impossible to create a pull request for a branch that isn't based on a commit in the target branch?

issue.title: mining, refactor: add m_mempool.cs thread safety lock assertions
issue.body:
in src/node/miner to

- BlockAssembler::addPackageTxs()
- BlockAssembler::SkipMapTxEntry()
- BlockAssembler::UpdatePackagesForAdded()

These functions have thread safety lock annotations in their declarations but are missing the corresponding run-time lock assertions in their definitions.

Per doc/developer-notes.md: "Combine annotations in function declarations with run-time asserts in function definitions."

events.body:
> I mean, a commit parent is not a merge commit.

I don't think we do or should require that. Would there be a reason?

Thanks, tested ACK faa185bb3abe5fdaeeae14706bad9437acac6a69
Can run the `bench_bitcoin` again without crashing my whole computer.
ACK, with this change merged I can run the bench tests again locally on master.

issue.title: bench: remove from available_coins with reference, vout size
issue.body: In the current mempool benchmarks, the coins were not being deleted from `available_coins` since `Available` rather than `Available&` was used. Also the lack of the reference meant that `coin.vin_left++` only incremented the copy's variable rather than the one in the vector. The removal condition previously compared the coin's `vin.size()` to `vin_left`, when it should have been using `vout.size()`. I changed the `MempoolCheck` bench to instead use `min_ancestors` of 1 rather than 5 as otherwise an underflow could occur when calling `coin.ref->vout.size() - coin.vin_left`. This previously did not occur since `vin_left` was always 0 since a copy of the coin was used. Using 1 vs 5 shouldn't give too much of a difference since the test can still generate more than 1 (or 5) ancestors.
